column4: okay, so it says that this command will uninstall Grub # dd if=/dev/null of=/dev/sdX bs=512 count=1
the usb thing is sdg
That command will WIPE OUT the disk's partition table
You've got Vista, right?
Only need to replace ~360 bytes in sector 0 - If you can find someone who has a Windows Vista installation with intact windows MBR it is easy to replace.
I can get into the BIOS when I start up the PC, I there some way to bypass GRUB from there?
No, GRUB has replaced the Windows boot-strap code in sector 0 of the hard-disk
Here is what it *should* look like :)
http://www.multibooters.co.uk/mbr.html
I was trying to locate a Vista MBR image someplace for you
Yes, but you'll end up needing a dual-boot setup, since with GRUB it needs somewhere to install the boot menu etc
Yes
That is a bit drastic! You only need to replace 446 bytes :)
Let's see if we can find someone that has it, then it's just a case of using dd to write it to the disk
You're on that PC running Ubuntu right now?
OK, but you can boot that PC with a Live CD or USb stick?
good - then it has the tool you need to write the data back
Still trying to find a copy of the MBR for you :)
Yeah... I'm digging through the Vista install on this laptop to extract the MBR for you
none! plently of people talking about, but not one I can find to download!
That's good, do it
Nice one, glad you got it fixed so painlesslyu
